India.title: 'Committed to take decisive action against terrorists': PM Modi
India.body_text: prime minister reiterated his resolve to take decisive action against terrorists . he thanked angola for extending support to india in its fight against cross-border terrorism . on the day of the attack, 26 male tourists were gunned down in pahalgam . india responded through a slew of diplomatic measures, with Pakistan undertaking similar retaliatory measures .

India.title: 'Born to serve J&K police and my country': Cop, family spared deportation to Pakistan after HC steps in
India.body_text: iftkhar Ali, 45, and his eight siblings narrowly escaped being deported to Pakistan . the intervention of the jammu & Kashmir and ladakh high court saved them from being sent across the border . Ali claims the deportation notice was triggered by a long-standing land dispute with his maternal uncle . despite the trauma, Ali expressed confidence in india's leadership .

India.title: 'Kashmir was and will always be part of India': Farooq Abdullah meets tourists in Pahalgam after terror attack
India.body_text: former j&k CM Farooq Abdullah visited pahalgam and interacted with tourists . in a heartfelt message to the victims, he said, "we also cried. we also didn't eat" he called the attack an act of inhuman brutality and urged the nation to stand united against terrorism . he declined to comment on remarks made by former Pakistan foreign minister Bilawal Bhutto .

India.title: No more mail, imports or ships from Pak: India slaps slew of bans amid rising tensions
India.body_text: the move marks a sharp escalation following the April 22 terror attack in pahalgam . 26 people, most of them tourists, were killed in the attack . from April 2024 to January 2025, india imported just $2.88 million worth of goods from Pakistan . the directive also prohibits Indian-flagged vessels from visiting pakistani ports .

India.title: After PM Modi, Rajnath Singh to skip Russia’s Victory Day parade; junior minister Sanjay Seth to attend: Report
India.body_text: the decision comes amid rising tensions between india and Pakistan following the recent terror attack in pahalgam . Russia had initially invited prime minister Narendra modi to the event marking the 80th anniversary of the Soviet victory over nazi germany in world war II . it was later decided that Rajnath Singh would attend on india's behalf, but now the junior defence minister is set to lead the delegation .

World.title: Temu halts shipping goods from China directly to US customers
World.body_text: Temu has stopped shipping products directly from china to US customers . instead, all orders will now be fulfilled from warehouses within the united states . the move comes following the closure of a provision that previously allowed Chinese-made products valued up to $800 to enter the u.s. without tariffs . president Donald Trump described the exemption as a big scam detrimental to american small businesses .

World.title: Russia downs 170 drones, 8 Western-supplied missiles over Crimea, other regions
World.body_text: 96 fixed wing drones over Crimea, 47 over Krasnodar territory, 9 over Rostov . 8 british-supplied storm shadow cruise missiles and 3 ukraine-developed Neptune-MD guided missiles destroyed over the black sea . governors of some regions have reported civilian damage from Ukrainian drone strikes . drone fragments caused a fire on the roof of a house in the village of Tselina .

World.title: Kosovo parliament deadlocked over speaker's election
World.body_text: three months of deadlock began with february 9 elections in which the prior ruling Vetevendosje (Self-Determination) party failed to secure a majority, winning 48 out of 120 seats . opposition accuses VV of deliberately blocking the formation of institutions . the deadlock is holding up ratification of international agreements under the EU's Growth Plan .

World.title: Australia's left-leaning labor party wins elections as PM Anthony Albanese eyes second term: Media projections
World.body_text: polls open at 8:00 am local time (2200 GMT) on the east coast, followed by western cities and territories . of the 18.1 million registered voters, roughly half had cast their ballots early . campaign centred on starkly different economic and environmental visions . incumbent, 62-year-old albanese, said he would leave nothing on the field if re-elected .

World.title: Polls close in Australian vote focused on high prices and shortage of housing
World.body_text: the election is taking place against a backdrop of what both sides describe as a cost of living crisis . if albanese wins, he'll become the first australian prime minister to win successive elections in 21 years . both campaigns promised policies to help first-home buyers buy into a property market that is too expensive . the last time neither party won a majority, it took 17 days before key independent lawmakers announced they would support a Labor administration .

Business.title: Why Rich Dad Poor Dad's author Robert Kiyosaki says 'Market crashes mean real assets go on sale'
Business.body_text: Kiyosaki believes fear of unemployment is spreading like a virus . he claims this fear may be the precursor to a “new great depression” . "this recession may turn into a full-blown depression," he warns . the recent news that has sold billions in stocks and now holds $325 billion in cash is a signal .

Business.title: US travel sector may lose billions in major slowdown as Donald Trump’s tariff policies hit tourism
Business.body_text: analysts warn that aggressive trade policies and tariff-driven uncertainty are eroding global sentiment and hurting travel-related industries . foreign travel spending alone is projected to trim 0.1% from US GDP this year . this translates to a potential loss of $23 billion to $71 billion, as per Reuters . the broader travel and tourism sector, which made 3% of GDP and supported over six million jobs in 2023, is now confronting its weakest start in recent times .

Business.title: India’s imports from Pakistan set to log zero from $0.5 million after complete ban: GTRI
Business.body_text: trade between 2024 and 2025 dwindled to just $ 0.42 million, restricted mostly to niche items like figs ($ 78,000), basil and rosemary herbs ($ 18,856) india doesn't depend on Pakistani goods, so the economic impact is minimal . the fresh import ban was part of a broader set of measures taken by the Indian government following the pahalgam attack .

Business.title: SBI Q4 net profit dips 10% YoY to Rs 18,642.59 crore, Rs 15.90 per share dividend declared
Business.body_text: india's largest public sector lender, state bank of india, reported a 10% year-on-year drop in net profit for the fourth quarter of FY25 . the bank posted a net profit of Rs 18,642.59 crore, compared to Rs 20,698.35 crore in the same period last year . despite the decline in profit, the bank's net interest income rose 2.7% YoY to Rs 42,774.55 crore .

Business.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q4 results: Standalone profit drops 14% to Rs 3,552 crore
Business.body_text: the bank posted a 14 per cent year-on-year decline in standalone net profit for the march quarter of FY25, posting Rs 3,552 crore compared to Rs 4,133 crore in the same period last year . for the full financial year ended march 31, 2025, the bank delivered a strong performance . net interest income for the March quarter increased 5 per cent yoy to Rs 7,284 crore . on a consolidated basis, the Kotak Mahindra Group reported a net profit of Rs 22,126

Technology.title: Claude AI-maker Anthropic to buy back employee shares: What it may mean for the AI startup backed by Google and Amazon
Technology.body_text: Anthropic will buy shares from current and former employees at a valuation of $61.5 billion . this match the valuation from its recent $3.5 billion Series E funding round . employee liquidity programs like this are becoming more common among AI startups . by the end of 2024, anthropic’s annualized revenue reached around $1 billion, up from $100 million at the start of the year .

Technology.title: 'Donate Rs 10 for RCB Good Luck': Influencers QR code 'experiment' for Virat Kohli's team goes viral, see result
Technology.body_text: an influencer conducted a fun social experiment showcasing the cricket craze in india . he created a QR code with the tongue-in-cheek appeal to Donate Rs 10 for RCB good luck . the experiment took an unexpected turn when strangers began contributing, resulting in Rs 1,200 in donations by the end of the day. the video has managed to garner more than 1 lakh views .

Technology.title: US Consumer safety body recalls 1.8 million pressure cookers of this brand after 100 customers suffer burn injuries
Technology.body_text: the CPSC has recalled nearly 2 million SharkNinja foodi OP300 series multi-function pressure cookers . more than 50 customers have sustained second- or third-degree burns to the face or body as a result of the malfunction . the affected units were sold across several retailers in the US, including walmart, costco, sam’s club, amazon, and target stores .

Technology.title: Google ad tech fate will be decided in trial set for September
Technology.body_text: the trial will delve into the specifics of how to address Google's dominance over the technology used by online publishers to sell advertisements . the DOJ lawsuit is seeking a significant structural remedy: the forced sale of google's publisher ad server . both google, a unit of alphabet, and the doj are expected to submit detailed proposals outlining their respective positions on potential remedies by Monday .
